Yixiong ChangLevel 5. GeniusUpdated on 06 Nov 2018Leaving a legacy for your children is a very personal choice. I can tell u are a very good parent, even in your later years u still want to give your children a better life.I can only help to provide some rational perspective for u to consider. I believe u will still have many good years to go, by then your children would be long a working adult and maybe married. Would they need the additional money at this time? (Yes, I know no one will think no amount of money is too much). The answer is probably not (as a need), therefore any amount left for them will be like a appreciated last gift.You might want to take a look at your assets. Do remember u will still have your home, which would be of considerable value as well. As well as your CPF monies(CPF medisave and CPF life if u choose the plan that leaves a larger legacy). And also any life insurance that u have already purchased.Additional way is to further make use of life insurance. Take a portion of the money and buy a single premium whole life insurance, which can guarantees multiple times of your invested money (3-8x) as insurance payout upon your passing. Such policies possess cash value which can be terminated early if u ever want to utilise the money. With this insurance u are free to enjoy your retirement, knowing your children will get at least $X amount of payout.Depending on your current age, other strategies can be used.It might also be time to consider proper legacy planning. Get your will written (with your spouse too, maybe a mirror will), so as to ensure your properties are properly distributed upon your passing.Do reply here or msg me on my facebook if I can further assist u.0 comments1
